name: Moustached Danio
description: A small fish with muted coloration and a black spot behind the head, named for its exceptionally long barbels on its mouth.
spread_note: Tributaries of large Indian rivers (e.g., Ganges, Brahmaputra)
reproduction: Spawns among plants, does not care for eggs.
attractions: Danios are small cyprinid fish inhabiting still or slow-moving waters with warm shallows ideal for spawning.
